# Heidi Health - Comprehensive Company Profile

**Last Updated:** November 2025
**Profile Status:** Complete
**Company Type:** AI Medical Scribe / Clinical Documentation Platform

---

## Executive Summary

Heidi Health is a Melbourne-based Australian health technology company that develops AI-powered medical scribe software for clinical documentation. Founded in 2019, the company has grown rapidly to become one of the fastest-scaling AI healthcare startups globally, supporting over 2 million patient consultations weekly across 116 countries and 200+ medical specialties. The company achieved a $704 million AUD ($465 million USD) valuation in October 2025 following its Series B round.

---

## 1. Company Details

### Founding Story

- **Founded:** 2019 (initially as "Oscer")
- **Rebranded:** 2021 (from Oscer to Heidi Health)
- **Product Launch:** February 2024

The company was initially launched under the name **Oscer**, focusing on clinical training tools for healthcare professionals—specifically an AI-driven app to help medical students pass OSCEs (Objective Structured Clinical Examinations). In 2021, the company pivoted and rebranded as Heidi Health, shifting focus to AI-powered clinical documentation.

The key insight driving the pivot: **"Clinicians actually quite like doing clinical work; we ought to eradicate admin instead."**

### Founders

| Name | Role | Background |
|------|------|------------|
| **Dr. Thomas Kelly** | CEO & Co-Founder | Vascular surgical resident; background in mathematics with lifelong interest in deep learning |
| **Waleed Mussa** | Co-Founder | Former Goldman Sachs analyst |
| **Yu Liu** | Co-Founder | Former Coles data scientist |

### Leadership Team

| Name | Role | Background |
|------|------|------------|
| **Dr. Thomas Kelly** | CEO & Co-Founder | Vascular surgeon turned health tech entrepreneur |
| **Dr. Simon Kos** | Chief Medical Officer | Former Chief Medical Officer at Microsoft Corp. |
| **Dr. Ben Condon** | Clinical Director | 8+ years clinical experience across 30+ Australian hospitals; former Eucalyptus healthtech; MBBS from Deakin University |
| **Paul Williamson** | Chief Revenue Officer | Former Salesforce executive; former Plaid revenue boss |

### Headquarters & Locations

- **Headquarters:** Melbourne, Australia
- **Office Locations:**
  - Melbourne (HQ)
  - Sydney
  - Brisbane
  - London, UK
  - New York, USA
  - Expanding to additional locations

### Employee Count

| Source | Employee Count | Notes |

**Growth Rate:** 131% employee count increase year-over-year

### Clinical Team

The company employs practicing physicians on staff for clinical governance and product development:

- **Dr. Thomas Kelly** - CEO (vascular surgery background)
- **Dr. Simon Kos** - CMO (former Microsoft CMO)
- **Dr. Ben Condon** - Clinical Director (surgical & critical care across 30+ hospitals including St Vincent's Hospital Melbourne ED)
- **Dr. Kieran McLeod** - Clinical team member

### Funding Rounds (Chronological)

#### Seed Round (2021)
- **Amount:** $5 million AUD (~$3.25M USD)
- **Lead Investor:** Blackbird Ventures
- **Notes:** Raised when company was still called "Oscer"

#### Series A (2023)
- **Amount:** $10 million AUD (~$6.5M USD)
- **Lead Investor:** Blackbird Ventures

#### Series A Extension (March 2025)
- **Amount:** $16.6 million USD (~$27 million AUD)
- **Lead Investor:** Headline
- **Participants:**
  - Local Globe
  - Anthology (Menlo Ventures + Anthropic joint fund)
  - Blackbird (existing)
  - HESTA
  - Possible Ventures
  - Archangel Ventures

#### Series B (October 2025)
- **Amount:** $65 million USD (~$98 million AUD)
- **Lead Investor:** Point72 Private Investments (Steve Cohen's fund)
- **Participants:**
  - Blackbird (existing)
  - Headline (existing)
  - Latitude (Phoenix Court growth fund)
- **Post-Money Valuation:** $465 million USD ($704 million AUD)
- **Valuation Increase:** 450%+ since May 2025

### Investor Mix

**Local Australian:**
- Blackbird Ventures (lead seed & Series A)
- HESTA (Australian superannuation fund)
- Archangel Ventures

**International:**
- Point72 Private Investments (US - Steve Cohen)

- Local Globe (UK)
- Anthology (Menlo Ventures + Anthropic)
- Possible Ventures
- Latitude/Phoenix Court

### Financial Health Indicators

- Rapid valuation growth (450%+ in ~5 months)
- Strong investor confidence with repeat participation
- $21.9 million revenue reported (GetLatka estimate)
- Well-capitalized with ~$100M total raised

---

## 3. Product

### Core Product: AI Medical Scribe

Heidi's core product is an **ambient AI medical scribe** that transcribes patient consultations and converts them into clinical notes, letters, and other documents.

### Key Product Features

#### Ambient Documentation
- **Ambient listening technology:** AI "sits in" on patient interviews and transcribes conversations
- **User-centered design:** Technology is "invisible," especially for non-tech-savvy clinicians
- **Background recording:** Blends into clinical workflow seamlessly

#### Transcription & Note Generation
- **Real-time dictation:** Clinicians can dictate during or after encounters
- **Batch transcription:** Company advocates batch over live transcription for quality
- **Multi-format support:** Upload PDFs, DOCs, images, handwritten notes to inform documentation
- **Context-aware processing:** LLMs correct mishearings in transcripts

#### Template System
- **Template Library:** Specialty-specific templates available in Template Community
- **Custom Templates:** Pro users get unlimited personalized templates
- **Template Components:** Section headings, placeholders, instructions, reusable blocks
- **Snippets:** Save frequently used phrases as reusable text blocks
- **Word Library:** Personal medical dictionary with preferred terminology, abbreviations, spelling corrections

#### Clinical Note Formats Supported
- **SOAP** (Subjective, Objective, Assessment, Plan)
- **SOAP (Issues)** - with Problem List
- **H & P** (History of Presenting Complaint)
- **DAP, BIRP, GIRP, PIRP** formats
- **ADIME** (for dieticians)
- **IMIST-AMBO** (for paramedics)

#### Document Types
- Progress notes
- Initial assessments
- Referral letters
- Discharge summaries
- Treatment reports
- Operative notes
- Clinic letters
- Second opinions
- Procedure reports

#### Automation Features
- **Task Extraction:** Auto-identifies actionable items (follow-ups, medication changes, referrals)
- **Billing Codes:** Auto-populates billing codes based on conversation context
- **Session Linking:** Connect past consultations for continuity of care

### Specialties Supported

**Specialty Coverage:** 200+ specialties supported

Heidi describes itself as **"specialty-agnostic"** and adapts to workflows including:
- General Practice / Primary Care
- Interventional Cardiology
- Pediatric Psychiatry
- Maxillofacial Surgery
- Orthopaedics
- Neurosurgery
- Mental Health
- Dietetics
- Paramedicine
- Dental
- And many more...

### Settings Supported
- Hospital (inpatient)
- Outpatient clinics
- Private practice
- Community care
- Residential care
- Telehealth
- Emergency departments

### Language Support

- **Languages:** 110+ languages supported
- **Regional Dialects:** Custom model engineered for regional dialects and medical terminology variations
- **Australian English:** Specifically handles Australian healthcare terminology, accents, and regional speech patterns
- **Word Error Rate:** Claims "market-leading" accuracy for regional transcription
- **Continuous Improvement:** Clinical governance team monitors and improves performance with local speech patterns

### Billing Code Localization
- **ICD-10-CM** (US)
- **SNOMED-CT** (UK)
- Regional coding guidelines and terminology by geography

### EHR Integrations
- Epic Systems
- Athenahealth
- Gentu by Magentus
- Veradigm
- Best Practice Software (Australia)
- MediRecords (Australia)
- MedicalDirector (Australia)
- Halaxy
- Many others

### Platform Availability
- Web application
- Mobile apps (iOS, Android)
- Desktop applications

### Performance Metrics
- **Documentation time reduction:** 51% per consult (proven in large clinical rollouts)
- **Time savings:** Up to 40% reduction in documentation time
- **Clinician adoption:** 60-70% average adoption (vs. 20-40% industry average per Dr. Kelly)
- **Hours returned:** 18 million hours returned to clinicians from 70+ million patient visits

## 4. Customers

### Customer Scale

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Weekly Patient Consultations** | 2+ million |
| **Total Patient Visits (to date)** | 70+ million |
| **Countries** | 116 |
| **Specialties** | 200+ |
| **KLAS Research Satisfaction** | 100% would purchase again |

### Named Enterprise Customers

#### Australia
- **Monash Health** - Major Melbourne health network
- **Queensland Health Children's Hospital and Health Service**
- **Hunter New England and Central Coast Primary Health Network (HNECC PHN)** - Regional GP pilot program

#### New Zealand
- **Health New Zealand Te Whatu Ora** - 16 emergency departments nationwide
  - 1,000 clinician licenses
  - 100 mental health crisis team licenses
  - Pilot started at Hawke's Bay Hospital ED

#### United Kingdom
- **Modality Partnership** - NHS's largest GP super-partnership
  - 360+ GPs across 53 sites
  - ~500,000 registered patients
  - Described as "world's largest clinical rollout of ambient AI"

#### United States
- **Beth Israel Lahey Health** (Massachusetts)
- **MaineGeneral Health** - Called Heidi a "transformation partner"
- **Mount Sinai Beth Israel Hospital** (New York)

#### Canada
- **Yukon Government** - Public health system adoption

### Customer Segments

| Segment | Coverage |
|---------|----------|
| **GP Clinics** | Primary market; ~100+ GPs in ~30 clinics (early 2023 data) |
| **Specialists** | 200+ specialties supported |
| **Hospitals** | Enterprise deployments (Beth Israel, Mount Sinai, Health NZ EDs) |
| **Health Networks** | Queensland Health, Monash Health, Modality Partnership |
| **Government** | Yukon Government, Health NZ, HNECC PHN |

### Geographic Coverage

**Strong Presence:**
- Australia (home market)
- New Zealand
- United Kingdom
- United States
- Canada

**Total Reach:** 116 countries, 50+ with significant presence

### Pricing Model

| Tier | Features |
|------|----------|
| **Free** | Basic features, limited usage |
| **Pro** | Unlimited personalized templates, full features |
| **Enterprise** | Custom pricing, dedicated support, integrations |

---

## 5. Leadership Vision & Strategy

### CEO Dr. Thomas Kelly - Key Statements

#### On the Problem Being Solved
> "Clinicians are overwhelmed by an unsustainable administrative workload. This destroys their wellbeing and drains away job satisfaction, resulting in an exodus of talented clinicians from the workforce – further reducing the capacity of our already frail healthcare systems."

> "Clinicians actually quite like doing clinical work; we ought to eradicate admin instead."

#### On the Mission
> "I founded Heidi to free doctors from non-clinical work so they can focus on their patients and enjoy fulfilling careers in medicine."

> "My mission is to **double healthcare capacity worldwide** through the adoption of AI."

#### On the Vision
> "Heidi was built to eliminate missed diagnoses by reducing the time it takes to deliver great primary care with a delightful experience for patients and doctors."

### Strategic Differentiation

#### Doctor-First Approach
- Builds tools based on what clinicians actually need
- Competitors focus on selling to hospital executives; Heidi prioritizes clinician adoption
- Product-led growth motion

#### Key Strategic Choices (Per Investors)
1. **Customization over complex integrations** - Focus on flexible templates over deep EHR lock-in
2. **Global-first strategy** - International expansion from day one
3. **Product-led growth** - Rivals tech giants like Canva and Atlassian in approach

#### Competitive Positioning
- Claims highest clinician adoption rates: 60-70% vs. industry 20-40%
- Focuses on "activation rather than licenses" as key metric
- Emphasizes workflows both inside and outside the EHR

### Growth Strategy

#### Geographic Expansion
- Expanding from Australia to US, UK, Canada, NZ
- Series B funds earmarked for US market expansion
- Already present in 116 countries

#### Product Evolution
- Moving "beyond ambient voice documentation to Care Partner"
- Expanding from documentation to clinical decision support
- Anticipating regulatory requirements for clinical reasoning AI

#### Enterprise Focus
- Shifting from individual clinicians to enterprise deployments
- Major health system partnerships (NHS Modality, Health NZ, Beth Israel)
- Government health system adoption

### Leadership Interviews & Media

#### Podcasts
- **Talking Health Tech #282** - "Giving Patients What They Deserve"
- **The Scrubbed In Show E112** - "Eliminating Delayed and Missed Diagnoses"
- **Day One FM** - "How to Build a Defensible AI Startup"
- **Financial Freedom Podcast #760** - "AI and the Future of Medicine"
- **NerdMDs Episode 21** - "Unlocking Access to Medical AI"

#### Press Coverage
- **Capital Brief** (March 2025) - Series A follow-on interview on differentiation and international expansion
- **Healthcare IT Today** (November 2025) - Moving beyond documentation to Care Partner
- **HealthSystemCIO** (September 2025) - Playbook for AI adoption beyond POCs

### Awards & Recognition
- Dr. Thomas Kelly named to **Becker's Health IT & Revenue Cycle Up and Comers** list

## 6. Compliance & Security

### Certifications
- **SOC2** - Enterprise security
- **ISO27001** - Information security management

### Regulatory Compliance
- **Australian Privacy Principles** (home market)
- **HIPAA** (United States)
- **GDPR** (Europe/UK)
- **PIPEDA** (Canada)
- **NHS Standards** (UK)

### Data Practices
- **No recording storage:** Does not store session recordings
- **No data sales:** Never shares or sells clinical data
- **Regional data localization:** Enterprise-grade data localization across AU, CA, US, UK

---

## 7. Competitive Landscape

### Direct Competitors
- Nuance/Microsoft DAX
- Abridge
- Nabla
- DeepScribe
- Suki AI
- Notable Health

### Heidi's Differentiated Position
- Australian origin with strong local healthcare understanding
- Product-led growth vs. enterprise-sales-first approach
- High claimed adoption rates (60-70%)
- Global-first expansion strategy
- Strong clinical team with practicing physician leadership
